intro: Melampyrum lineare var. americanum, commonly known as American yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and meadows. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually yellow or orange in color. It has a slender, erect stem and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind.
